original_table_html:
Brand Knowledge Brand Awareness Attributes Benefits Attitudes
Brand recall Non-product-related Functional
Brand recognition Product-related Experiential
Brand Image Types of brand association Price Symbolic
Favorability of brand associations User and usage imagery
Strength of brand associations Brand personality
Uniqueness of brand associations Feelings and experiences
summary_markdown: This table outlines the components of Brand Knowledge, which encompasses Brand Awareness, Attributes, Benefits, and Attitudes. Brand Awareness is further divided into Brand Recall and Brand Recognition. Brand Knowledge also includes Brand Image, which is characterized by the Favorability, Strength, and Uniqueness of brand associations. Attributes are categorized into Non-product-related and Product-related types. Benefits are classified as Functional, Experiential, and Symbolic. Finally, Attitudes represent the overall evaluation of the brand. The structure suggests a hierarchical breakdown of Brand Knowledge, with Brand Image acting as a significant component influencing the other elements.
